title: "Open Directory" in Profile Directory with Flatpak install goes nowhere after new install to Linux (trying to move profile to new laptop) (bug1625111)
content:
Hi,

I'm trying to move Thunderbird from my Windows 10 laptop to one where I just installed Linux (Zorin Pro 17.3). I followed the instructions here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

I installed Thunderbird 140.4.0 esr, which is the latest version. Both laptops now have that version installed.

But when I open TB on the Linux computer, and close the Account Setup window, and go to the Troubleshooting screen, next to "Profile Directory" it says "Open Directory", but when I click on that, nothing happens. So how can I paste my TB profile? Do I have to start a new profile first, and then copy over that?

I installed TB from the "Software" area, which I believe is a Flatpak. I'm very new to Linux, so just fumbling around here. There were 3 options of Thunderbird. I installed the one that had the most information and seemed most up to date. That was confusing.

I would LOVE some help on this.

Thanks!
creator: DD46

title: address re-indexing failed
content:
I am using Windows 10 Enterprise LTSC, Version 21H2, and Mozilla Thunderbird 140.3.1esr (64-Bit)

Suddenly, the number of entries in my address book has shrunk to 259. The size of the file abook.sqlite was 768 kB. Following the advice on https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/rebuilding-global-database, I did Rebuilding the Global Database That did not have an effect on my address book, the lost email addresses did not reappear. What can I do?

Matthias (now to this forum)
creator: matthias76

title: Archives versus Archive
content:
Some time this year Thunderbird started using an Archive folder instead of the existing Archives folder. I have over ten years of archived messages in the Archives folders.

I want to stop the archiving into the Archive folders. I also want to delete the Archive folders but it is not an available option.
creator: Alan_Liefting
